<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>protected </span>registerOutputs(outputs?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a> | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a>&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>Output</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a>&gt;): <span class='kd'><a href='https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/basic-types.html#void'>void</a></span></code></pre>


registerOutputs registers synthetic outputs that a component has initialized, usually by
allocating other child sub-resources and propagating their resulting property values.

ComponentResources can call this at the end of their constructor to indicate that they are
done creating child resources.  This is not strictly necessary as this will automatically be
called after the `initialize` method completes.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="EC2TaskDefinition" data-link-title="EC2TaskDefinition">

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>EC2TaskDefinition</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#ComponentResource'>ComponentResource</a></code></pre>

Create a TaskDefinition resource with the given unique name, arguments, and options.
Creates required log-group and task & execution roles.
Presents required Service load balancers if target group included in port mappings.

when multiple copies of the Pulumi SDK have been loaded into the same process.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateService-registerOutputs">

</h4>


<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>protected </span>registerOutputs(outputs?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a> | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a>&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>Output</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a>&gt;): <span class='kd'><a href='https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/basic-types.html#void'>void</a></span></code></pre>


registerOutputs registers synthetic outputs that a component has initialized, usually by
allocating other child sub-resources and propagating their resulting property values.

ComponentResources can call this at the end of their constructor to indicate that they are
done creating child resources.  This is not strictly necessary as this will automatically be
called after the `initialize` method completes.

    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>FargateTaskDefinition</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#ComponentResource'>ComponentResource</a></code></pre>

Create a TaskDefinition resource with the given unique name, arguments, and options.

Presents required Service load balancers if target group included in port mappings.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-forceNewDeployment">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L126">property <b>forceNewDeployment</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>forceNewDeployment?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Enable to force a new task deployment of the service. This can be used to update tasks to use a newer Docker image with same image/tag combination (e.g., `myimage:latest`), roll Fargate tasks onto a newer platform version, or immediately deploy `ordered_placement_strategy` and `placement_constraints` updates.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-healthCheckGracePeriodSeconds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L130">property <b>healthCheckGracePeriodSeconds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>healthCheckGracePeriodSeconds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Seconds to ignore failing load balancer health checks on newly instantiated tasks to prevent premature shutdown, up to 2147483647. Only valid for services configured to use load balancers.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-iamRole">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L134">property <b>iamRole</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>iamRole?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

ARN of the IAM role that allows Amazon ECS to make calls to your load balancer on your behalf. This parameter is required if you are using a load balancer with your service, but only if your task definition does not use the `awsvpc` network mode. If using `awsvpc` network mode, do not specify this role. If your account has already created the Amazon ECS service-linked role, that role is used by default for your service unless you specify a role here.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-loadBalancers">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L138">property <b>loadBalancers</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>loadBalancers?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;ServiceLoadBalancer&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Configuration block for load balancers. See below.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-name">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L142">property <b>name</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>name?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Name of the service (up to 255 letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores)

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-networkConfiguration">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L146">property <b>networkConfiguration</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>networkConfiguration?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;ServiceNetworkConfiguration&gt;;</code></pre>

Network configuration for the service. This parameter is required for task definitions that use the `awsvpc` network mode to receive their own Elastic Network Interface, and it is not supported for other network modes. See below.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-orderedPlacementStrategies">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L150">property <b>orderedPlacementStrategies</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>orderedPlacementStrategies?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;ServiceOrderedPlacementStrategy&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Service level strategy rules that are taken into consideration during task placement. List from top to bottom in order of precedence. Updates to this configuration will take effect next task deployment unless `force_new_deployment` is enabled. The maximum number of `ordered_placement_strategy` blocks is `5`. See below.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-placementConstraints">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L154">property <b>placementConstraints</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>placementConstraints?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;ServicePlacementConstraint&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Rules that are taken into consideration during task placement. Updates to this configuration will take effect next task deployment unless `force_new_deployment` is enabled. Maximum number of `placement_constraints` is `10`. See below.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-platformVersion">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L158">property <b>platformVersion</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>platformVersion?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Platform version on which to run your service. Only applicable for `launch_type` set to `FARGATE`. Defaults to `LATEST`. More information about Fargate platform versions can be found in the [AWS ECS User Guide](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/platform_versions.html).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-propagateTags">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L162">property <b>propagateTags</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>propagateTags?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies whether to propagate the tags from the task definition or the service to the tasks. The valid values are `SERVICE` and `TASK_DEFINITION`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-schedulingStrategy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L166">property <b>schedulingStrategy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>schedulingStrategy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Scheduling strategy to use for the service. The valid values are `REPLICA` and `DAEMON`. Defaults to `REPLICA`. Note that [*Tasks using the Fargate launch type or the `CODE_DEPLOY` or `EXTERNAL` deployment controller types don't support the `DAEMON` scheduling strategy*](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/APIReference/API_CreateService.html).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-serviceRegistries">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L170">property <b>serviceRegistries</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>serviceRegistries?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;ServiceServiceRegistries&gt;;</code></pre>

Service discovery registries for the service. The maximum number of `service_registries` blocks is `1`. See below.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-tags">

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>tags?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;{[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;}&gt;;</code></pre>

Key-value map of resource tags. If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-taskDefinition">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2service.ts#L178">property <b>taskDefinition</b></a>

Family and revision (`family:revision`) or full ARN of the task definition that you want to run in your service. Either [taskDefinition] or [taskDefinitionArgs] must be provided.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-taskDefinitionArgs">

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs" data-link-title="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2taskDefinition.ts#L98">

    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>EC2TaskDefinitionArgs</span></code></pre>

The set of arguments for constructing a EC2TaskDefinition resource.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs-container">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2taskDefinition.ts#L105">property <b>container</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>container?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/awsx/types/input/#TaskDefinitionContainerDefinitionArgs'>inputs.ecs.TaskDefinitionContainerDefinitionArgs</a>;</code></pre>

Single container to make a TaskDefinition from.  Useful for simple cases where there aren't
multiple containers, especially when creating a TaskDefinition to call [run] on.

Either [container] or [containers] must be provided.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs-containers">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2taskDefinition.ts#L112">property <b>containers</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>containers?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | {[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/awsx/types/input/#TaskDefinitionContainerDefinitionArgs'>TaskDefinitionContainerDefinitionArgs</a>};</code></pre>

All the containers to make a TaskDefinition from.  Useful when creating a Service that will
contain many containers within.

Either [container] or [containers] must be provided.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs-cpu">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/ec2taskDefinition.ts#L116">property <b>cpu</b></a>

The number of cpu units used by the task. If not provided, a default will be computed based on the cumulative needs specified by [containerDefinitions]

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs-ephemeralStorage">

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="FargateServiceArgs" data-link-title="FargateServiceArgs">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L86">

    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>FargateServiceArgs</span></code></pre>

The set of arguments for constructing a FargateService resource.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-assignPublicIp">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L90">property <b>assignPublicIp</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>assignPublicIp?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Assign a public IP address to the ENI (Fargate launch type only). Valid values are `true` or `false`. Default `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-cluster">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L94">property <b>cluster</b></a>

ARN of an ECS cluster.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-continueBeforeSteadyState">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L98">property <b>continueBeforeSteadyState</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>continueBeforeSteadyState?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

If `true`, this provider will not wait for the service to reach a steady state (like [`aws ecs wait services-stable`](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/ecs/wait/services-stable.html)) before continuing. Default `false`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-deploymentCircuitBreaker">

Configuration block for deployment circuit breaker. See below.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-deploymentMaximumPercent">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L110">property <b>deploymentMaximumPercent</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>deploymentMaximumPercent?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Upper limit (as a percentage of the service's desiredCount) of the number of running tasks that can be running in a service during a deployment. Not valid when using the `DAEMON` scheduling strategy.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-deploymentMinimumHealthyPercent">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L114">property <b>deploymentMinimumHealthyPercent</b></a>

Lower limit (as a percentage of the service's desiredCount) of the number of running tasks that must remain running and healthy in a service during a deployment.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-desiredCount">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L118">property <b>desiredCount</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>desiredCount?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Number of instances of the task definition to place and keep running. Defaults to 0. Do not specify if using the `DAEMON` scheduling strategy.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-enableEcsManagedTags">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-enableExecuteCommand">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-forceNewDeployment">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L130">property <b>forceNewDeployment</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>forceNewDeployment?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Enable to force a new task deployment of the service. This can be used to update tasks to use a newer Docker image with same image/tag combination (e.g., `myimage:latest`), roll Fargate tasks onto a newer platform version, or immediately deploy `ordered_placement_strategy` and `placement_constraints` updates.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-healthCheckGracePeriodSeconds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L134">property <b>healthCheckGracePeriodSeconds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>healthCheckGracePeriodSeconds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Seconds to ignore failing load balancer health checks on newly instantiated tasks to prevent premature shutdown, up to 2147483647. Only valid for services configured to use load balancers.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-iamRole">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L138">property <b>iamRole</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>iamRole?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

ARN of the IAM role that allows Amazon ECS to make calls to your load balancer on your behalf. This parameter is required if you are using a load balancer with your service, but only if your task definition does not use the `awsvpc` network mode. If using `awsvpc` network mode, do not specify this role. If your account has already created the Amazon ECS service-linked role, that role is used by default for your service unless you specify a role here.

Configuration block for load balancers. See below.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-networkConfiguration">

Network configuration for the service. This parameter is required for task definitions that use the `awsvpc` network mode to receive their own Elastic Network Interface, and it is not supported for other network modes. See below.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-placementConstraints">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L154">property <b>placementConstraints</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>placementConstraints?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;ServicePlacementConstraint&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Rules that are taken into consideration during task placement. Updates to this configuration will take effect next task deployment unless `force_new_deployment` is enabled. Maximum number of `placement_constraints` is `10`. See below.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-platformVersion">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L158">property <b>platformVersion</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>platformVersion?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Platform version on which to run your service. Only applicable for `launch_type` set to `FARGATE`. Defaults to `LATEST`. More information about Fargate platform versions can be found in the [AWS ECS User Guide](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/platform_versions.html).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-propagateTags">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L162">property <b>propagateTags</b></a>

Specifies whether to propagate the tags from the task definition or the service to the tasks. The valid values are `SERVICE` and `TASK_DEFINITION`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-schedulingStrategy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateService.ts#L166">property <b>schedulingStrategy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>schedulingStrategy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Scheduling strategy to use for the service. The valid values are `REPLICA` and `DAEMON`. Defaults to `REPLICA`. Note that [*Tasks using the Fargate launch type or the `CODE_DEPLOY` or `EXTERNAL` deployment controller types don't support the `DAEMON` scheduling strategy*](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/APIReference/API_CreateService.html).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-serviceRegistries">

Service discovery registries for the service. The maximum number of `service_registries` blocks is `1`. See below.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-container">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateTaskDefinition.ts#L104">property <b>container</b></a>

Single container to make a TaskDefinition from.  Useful for simple cases where there aren't
multiple containers, especially when creating a TaskDefinition to call [run] on.

Either [container] or [containers] must be provided.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-containers">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateTaskDefinition.ts#L111">property <b>containers</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>containers?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | {[key: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>]: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/awsx/types/input/#TaskDefinitionContainerDefinitionArgs'>TaskDefinitionContainerDefinitionArgs</a>};</code></pre>

All the containers to make a TaskDefinition from.  Useful when creating a Service that will
contain many containers within.

Either [container] or [containers] must be provided.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-cpu">

The number of cpu units used by the task. If not provided, a default will be computed based on the cumulative needs specified by [containerDefinitions]

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-ephemeralStorage">

The amount of ephemeral storage to allocate for the task. This parameter is used to expand the total amount of ephemeral storage available, beyond the default amount, for tasks hosted on AWS Fargate. See Ephemeral Storage.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-executionRole">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/43b8dabc0ec1e5187bf63e107bf06ee54021a1a7/sdk/nodejs/ecs/fargateTaskDefinition.ts#L124">property <b>executionRole</b></a>

Will be created automatically if not defined.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-family">
